body:
Got the same results today.
Tested: 1GB RAW Data with Windows 7 64Bit Upload
Ping to SFTP/FTP: ~ 37ms , 10MBit/s Upload
rclone Version 1.36 and 1.37 SFTP

- Filezilla got around 1 MB/s
- rclone getting around 560 KB/s
- 2 x rclone getting 1 MB/s (NOT transfers=2, used 2 different tasks)

Interesting:

- rclone Version 1.36 with ARM64 is reaching the full 1MB/s without problem on my odroid C2

Workaround is using Crypt -> FTP or opening two seperate rclone sessions with Windows

Would be nice to see support for SFTP transfers larger than 1

issue.title: SFTP slow down due to latency

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
When filing an issue, please include the following information if possible as well as a description of the problem.  Make sure you test with the latest beta of rclone.

    http://beta.rclone.org/
    http://rclone.org/downloads/

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the [rclone forum](https://forum.rclone.org/) instead of filing an issue.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

Latest

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows


> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

SFTP

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

It appears as latency goes up. Transfer speeds go down at an unnatural rate.
https://forum.rclone.org/t/slow-sftp-transfers-compared-to-alternatives/1097/7
At 1ms delay I get 100 MB/s
At 10ms delay I get 73 MB/s
At 100ms delay I get 9 MB/s

issue.title: SFTP only works with --transfers=1

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.36
> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
SMP Debian 3.16.39-1+deb8u2 (2017-03-07)
> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
SFTP
> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone copy XX_SFTP:/ GS_XX:XX --include=XX* -vv --size-only --transfers=2
> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
2017/05/01 17:13:48 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "XX_SFTP:/ XX:XX" "GS_XX:XX" "--include=XX*" "-vv" "--size-only" "--transfers=2"]
2017/05/01 17:13:58 INFO  : Storage bucket XX path XX: Modify window is 1s
2017/05/01 17:13:58 DEBUG : YYFILE: Excluded from sync (and deletion)
2017/05/01 17:13:58 DEBUG : XXFILE: Sizes identical
2017/05/01 17:13:58 DEBUG : XXFILE: Unchanged skipping
2017/05/01 17:13:58 ERROR : XXFILE2: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: Open failed: sftp: "The requested operation cannot be performed because there is a file transfer in progress." (SSH_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED)

Only 1 transfer can be done successful. when "--transfers=1" everything works fine. I can transfer multiple files from/to that same SFTP using lftp. What is the logical difference here? rclone is not opening multiple connections? Maybe?

Thanks for all the help!

body:
This implements connection pooling for multiple ssh connections
    
    A connection may be opened for each `--transfers` and `--checkers`
    now.  Connections are checked when putting them in the pool and
    getting them out the pool so it should recover from network errors
    much better.

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.37-076-g5b6585f5/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Please test and reopen the issue if you are still having a problem, or make a new issue with more info.

Thanks

issue.title: How to avoid upload speed degrading with latency?

repository.name: sftp
repository.description: SFTP support for the go.crypto/ssh package

issue.body:
We've been integrating sftp package into [rclone](https://github.com/ncw/rclone) and it is working very well - a very nicely designed package, thank you.

However a user has noticed a performance problem which I've confirmed - the more latency in the internet connection, the slower the transfers.

I've been using [netelem](https://wiki.linuxfoundation.org/networking/netem) to set delays on localhost and trying transfers to and from a local sftp server.

  * At 1ms delay I get 100 MB/s
  * At 10ms delay I get 73 MB/s
  * At 100ms delay I get 9 MB/s

rclone uses the `File.ReadFrom` method to upload data.

I tried increasing `MaxPacket` in the client using a delay of 100ms, but anything greater than the default 32k just seemed to make things slower.

Any ideas on how to speed things up much appreciated.

Cheers

Nick

FYI Here is how I tested with rclone to a local sftp server

```
$ sudo tc qdisc change dev lo root netem delay 1ms
$ rclone -v copy /home/files/ISOs/ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso TestSftp:
2017/02/20 22:28:02 INFO  : 
Transferred:   1.409 GBytes (100.970 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:       14.2s
$ rclone delete TestSftp:ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso

$ sudo tc qdisc change dev lo root netem delay 10ms
$ rclone -v copy /home/files/ISOs/ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso TestSftp:
2017/02/20 22:28:38 INFO  : 
Transferred:   1.409 GBytes (73.208 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:       19.7s
$ rclone delete TestSftp:ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso

$ sudo tc qdisc change dev lo root netem delay 100ms
$ rclone -v copy /home/files/ISOs/ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso TestSftp:
2017/02/20 22:31:34 INFO  : 
Transferred:   1.409 GBytes (9.362 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:     2m34.1s
$ rclone delete TestSftp:ubuntu-16.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso
```

body:
@ncw Not sure i can re-open. 
I havent messed with this in a while but just got faster internet net speeds and i can max filezilla at 360Mbps which is my internet speed, I can achieve this using 6 connections or less with filezilla. Rclone with 6 tansfers is going about 60Mbps 
This was tested with 1.41
1 thread in filezilla will climb to a speed of about 90Mbps where rclone is capping at about 7 Mbps
